reporting-org.narrative: European Centre for Development Policy Management (ECDPM)

title.narrative: 12. Citizens and civil society empowerment as drivers for inclusive and sustainable development

description.narrative: This work stream aims to contribute to the following changes:1) Civil society organisations and citizen movements (in Africa) are empowered to influence public policies, monitor the quality of governance (including economic governance), push for a more rights based approach to development (with a particular focus on gender equality) and demand transparency / accountability for policies and the use of public resources (particularly at local level).2) Civil society organisations, citizens and citizen movements (in Africa) are empowered to engage in “multi-actor partnerships” with public authorities, private sector and/or other (local) stakeholders, for delivering public goods and services (at local, national, regional and global levels).3) EU and Member States engage strategically with civil society organisations in the broad sense, including with social and citizen movements in relevant development, political and international cooperation processes (including by providing effective forms of financial and non-financial support). It also means improving the engagement of civil society in new EU frameworks for international cooperation (e.g. successor to CPA)

provider-org.narrative: European Centre for Development Policy Management (ECDPM)
European Centre for Development Policy Management (ECDPM)
European Centre for Development Policy Management (ECDPM)

description.narrative: Biennial outcome narrative by ECDPM assessing the progress made towards the envisaged outcomes in the period: 2017-01-01 - 2019-03-31

comment.narrative: ECDPM reports biennially on its outcomes in a narrative

The workstream on "Citizens and Civil Society empowerment as drivers for inclusive and sustainable development” was adopted to reflect the prominence of human agency, exercised through active citizenship or an organized third dimension (beyond states and markets) in the ECDPM Strategy 2017-2021. ECDPM could also fall back on more than 20 years of active engagement in this area (at both policy and operational levels). ECDPM continues to analyse state-society relations as integral components of the contexts in which it operates. It also works with private sector actors, with professional associations, with other think tanks in Africa around specific problem areas or in specific (sub)sectors ranging from inclusive value chain development to peace and security challenges. Given the mainstreaming of this vital dimension to change dynamics, ECDPM has decided to not continue to treat it as a separate workstream. At an aggregated level, the Centre will be able to demonstrate that it has continued to engage with organised civil society in various core policy processes.
